Text.Value: Boy! At the ready. Once I've taken control of the aasimar, she must go directly into the caging runes.
I have more magic in my little finger than you do in this entire tower. You cannot stop us both.
My apologies, Dame Aylin. I meant no disrespect. I asked our mutual friend here to make an introduction that I might get to meet the famed daughter of Sel√ªne.

EditorData.NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

Text.Value: Dame Aylin does not go anywhere quietly.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stiffening, realizing she's going to need to fight off her enemies AND her ally

Text.Value: Ah, Aylin, I look forward to getting to know you for the next eternity.
Reconsider your position, Lorroakan. Nothing can hold the daughter of Sel√ªne in perpetuity.
And haven't I suffered enough? Hasn't the road here been almost as hellish as the Hells we were sent to?
Aylin, I don't trust this. We should go.
This will be the last time you betray My Majesty. Today, I will end your life. End it for once and for all.
My gods! The Nightsong is a person?

EditorData.NodeContext: Under his breath. He's shocked, but he's not the star of this scene. This is an aside.

Text.Value: By my honour! It's you! My dear, I thought you were -

EditorData.NodeContext: Surprised; player previously convinced him she was dead

Text.Value: My magic is yours to command, Master Lorroakan. Simply say the word.
It is mine, I assure you. Perhaps I ought to explain why I went to such tremendous lengths to find you.
It would be nice to have a mentor who actually taught me magic. Or was competent.
You're smarter than this, Rolan - don't make me kill you.
I had hoped to appeal to your better nature. Perhaps I overestimated you. No bother. I have an arsenal of implements capable of convincing you to see reason.
This will be much easier if you go quietly, Aylin.
No, Master Lorroakan. I would never have assisted you if I knew you planned such horrors.
Go? So that this magus might send his jesters to harangue me night and day?
You saved my sister, so I wanted to show you kindness. But I suppose we're past that now.
Traitor! I will bring this tower to the ground before I'll hear another word.
A pity - but let it be said that we tried to be reasonable. Dame Aylin, if you will not go quietly, then you'll go kicking and screaming.
Forgive me for that impudence. Perhaps our friend can bridge the gap, and do what I believe they came here to do.

EditorData.NodeContext: Suggestive - the subtext being "let's start the attack"

Text.Value: I'd hoped you'd keep an open mind, but it seems you're determined to make this as difficult as possible.
Consider this my formal resignation, Lorroakan.
Pleasure.
If they're all like you, I think that sounds like an excellent bargain.
Come now, Rolan. If a wizard wants power, they have to take it.
Ugh. One more hurdle on my path to greatness: a conscience.
So speak, O loathsome one. Give me one good reason why I should not cave your head into your neck.
You think I'll watch my life's work falter so easily? Now that the device is in my hands, and the Nightsong is at my fingertips?
Choose your next words very carefully, apprentice. I do not suffer insubordination.
It's over for you, wizard. You can't overpower both of us.
At last. There you are, my dear.

EditorData.NodeContext: With low menace

Text.Value: Look, you need to stop this - please. Just hand her - hand the Nightsong over.
Please. Allow me to explain.
I'm just here to watch.
I have great plans for you, Dame Aylin. And if you will not go quietly, then you'll go kicking and screaming.
My steel-hearted friend speaks true. Give me one good reason, magus, why I should not strike you down where you stand.
You're wrong. I'm exactly where I need to be.
There is nothing I cannot do.
If this came to blows, Lia would never forgive me. Cal is only alive because of you.
Master Lorroakan will lead me to my destiny. A destiny I deserve. My magic is yours, master - say the word.
I am, aren't I? And I most certainly shouldn't spend my days dusting scrolls I'm not allowed to read.
You are twice the wizard Lorroakan is. Don't do this.
Myrmidons - imperatum!

EditorData.NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

Text.Value: Don't ally yourself with a monster, Rolan. Not after all you've suffered.
You lied to get the Nightsong here. Made us all believe she was nothing but a relic. I have seen what true leadership can accomplish - but never under your tutelage.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nods to the player for 'true leadership'. This is a compliment to the player and a slight to Lorroak

Text.Value: Lorroakan's magic is tainted, Rolan. You can do better.
You saved my brother, so I wanted to show you kindness. But I suppose we're past that now.
They say madness and genius are separated by but a hair's breadth. Perhaps the same is true of madness and stupidity.

EditorData.NodeContext: Scornful.

Text.Value: And you shall have it. This I promise you.
Master, let us show these amateurs the price they pay for challenging real wizards.
You've offered a huge sum to whoever brings you the Nightsong. Explain why.
Perhaps he can bridge the gap and do what I believe he came here to do.
Perhaps she can bridge the gap and do what I believe she came here to do.
Perhaps they can bridge the gap and do what I believe they came here to do.

EditorData.NodeContext: Suggestive - the subtext being "let's start the attack"

Text.Value: Myrmidons - IMPERATUM!

EditorData.NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

Text.Value: You leave me no choice. Lorroakan is my master - I owe him my fealty.
Be reasonable, madame. You can't outmatch two powerful wizards.

EditorData.NodeContext: sarcasm

Text.Value: No. We have come for answers. And, if needed, heads.
Tut. A pity you didn't prove a more reliable ally. You could've reaped the rewards of my good favour.
You serve your mother Sel√ªne, I believe. She who has blessed our realm with so many gifts. Honour her by sharing yours.
You dare to threaten me with the same magic that held me in torment for a hundred years.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slightly in disbelief at his foolishness

Text.Value: You will address me with due deference. I am Dame Aylin. And you are a whelp without honour, without pride, with nothing but a tower full of trinkets.
Watch your tongue, you child! I could make it such that no wizard in the realm will touch you.
Do not play; do not jest. We have come to square off against an enemy most loathsome.
You do not seek to share my gifts. You seek to poach them.
Perhaps we could start over. I am Lorroakan. I am most pleased to make your acquaintance. And that of your fine companion, who perhaps heard I was looking for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

Text.Value: If this came to blows, Cal would never forgive me. Lia is only alive because of you.
You can have the immortal, Lorroakan. But I expect a fine reward in return.
Enough. One more word about this, and it'll be your last.
Ho! Face us, charlatan. We who detest you so.

EditorData.NodeContext: With excitement/ a laugh - she gets to fight Lorroakan now

Text.Value: Dame Aylin, I have discovered a device that would allow your immortality to be shared. It would cause you no harm, no pain of any kind.
Magicians and their plans for Dame Aylin. Predictable; sadistic; flaccid.

EditorData.NodeContext: With a little laugh on the first bit. (This precedes 'You wont' be laughing for long' from Lorroakan)

Text.Value: A man named Ketheric Thorm already tried stealing Nightsong's immortality. He's dead now.
What are you so scared of, magus? Not the Nightsong, surely - why, she's nothing but a relic to be purchased and pursued.
Our friend told me you had died. I am most pleased to see that isn't true. A whimsical misunderstanding, I'm sure.

EditorData.NodeContext: With chagrin and suspicion, though barely keeping his veneer of civility

Text.Value: My apologies, Dame Aylin. I meant no disrespect.

EditorData.NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

Text.Value: Attack Rolan and Lorroakan.
What have we here? A magician in a tower, hiding away from the frightening world.

EditorData.NodeContext: Disdain; she hates this wizard

Text.Value: I came to stop you, Lorroakan.
I know what it is to be tempted by power. Don't repeat my mistakes.
And I don't suffer fools, Lorroakan.
But his magic lives.
Myrmidons - IMPERATUM!

EditorData.NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

Text.Value: You aren't the first to underestimate me, Gale of Waterdeep. But you may well be the last.

Synopsis: Nightsong's confrontation with Lorroakan in his tower, once the player tells Nightsong (or she finds out) that Lorroakan is looking for her.
